> When I call fail(), I provide a message that is fairly long.  
Unfortuntely, 
> this message doesn't completely print out.  There seems to be a limit 
to the 
> message length.  Can I change this limit?  If not, is there a place I 
could 
> get the entire message?

From the file : doc/JUnitProperties.html

The TestRunners use a properties file for preference settings. This file 
is stored in the folder referred to by the "user.home" system property. 
The following properties are supported: 

[...]

maxmessage: The maximum output length. Default value=500. Set maxmessage 
to -1 to disable output truncation. Disabling the output truncation will 
result in long test runs when an assertEquals method fails and the 
toString() method results in massive output.

-Vladimir
